StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: PGC: The PUWMa GWAS of ADHD

Person.Organization: SYRACUSE VA MEDICAL CENTERUPSTATE MEDICAL UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The datasets used for the analysis described in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap through dbGaP accession number [insert accession #]. Submission of the data, [insert accession #], to dbGaP was provided by Dr. Eric Mick on behalf of the PUWMa Consortium. Subject ascertainment and assessment was supported by the following sources: NIH Grants R13MH059126, R01MH62873, U01MH085518 and R01MH081803 to Stephen Faraone; NINDS grant NS054124 to Sandra Loo; NIMH grant MH01966 to James McGough; NIMH grant MH01805 to James McCracken, NIDA grant K24 DA016264 to Timothy Wilens; NIMH grant MH63706 to Susuan Smalley; and NIMH grants K08MH001503 and R01MH066237 to Janet Wozniak.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: ADHD and Related Disorders
ConsentGroup.name: ADHD_RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Appropriate research use of the data is for study of ADHD and related disorders, traits, or conditions.
